text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Vaccination 1..1ElementVaccination
given 0..*booleanImmunization Administration Status
agent 0..*CodeableConceptImmunizing Agent (Generic)
targetDisease 0..*CodeableConceptVaccine Preventable Disease
product 0..*BackboneElementAdministrable Product
agent 0..*CodeableConceptAdministrable Immunizing Agent (Trade Name)
marketAuthorizationHolder 0..*OrganizationMarket Authorization Holder (MAH)
manufacturer 0..*Organizationmanufacturer
antigen 0..*CodeableConceptAntigen
lotNumber 0..1stringAdministrable Immunizing Agent Lot Number
expiryDate 0..1dateTimeImmuning Agent Expiry Date
stregth 0..*QuantityImmunizationDose VolumeUnit of Measure
doseNumber 0..1integerDose Number
seriesDoseNumber 0..1integerSeries Dose Number
seriesComplete 0..1booleanVaccination series complete
administration 0..1BackboneElementImmunization Administration
date 0..1dateTimeDate of Immunization Administration
estimatedDate 0..1booleanEstimated Date Flag
doseVolume 0..*QuantityDose Volume
routeOfAdministration 0..1CodeableConceptImmunization Route of Administration
anatomicalSite 0..1CodeableConceptImmunization Anatomical Site
recordedDate 0..1dateTimeRecorded Date
source 0..*BackboneElementImmunization Reporting Source
reaction 0..*BackboneElementAdverse Reaction
flag 0..1booleanAdverse Reaction Following Immunization Reported
date 0..1dateTimeReaction date
detail 0..1BackboneElementReaction detail
note 0..1markdownImmunization Notes
forecast 0..1BackboneElementClient's immunization forecast
creationDate 0..1dateTimeImmunization Forecast Status Generated Date
date 0..*BackboneElementImmunization Forecast Date
type 0..1CodeableConceptImmunization Forecast Date Type
value 0..1dateTimeImmunization Forecast Date
status 0..1BackboneElementImmunization Forecast Status

Documentation for this format

element.definition: Vaccination

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Provides the status of the immunization event, i.e., was the vaccine dose administered?

Generic representation of the formulation administered to a client that includes one or more specific antigen(s) aimed at developing an immune response in an individual to provide protection from a vaccine preventable disease(s).
The disease that the vaccination provides protection against.
Administrable Product

A Medicinal Product administered to a client that includes one or more specific antigen(s) aimed at developing an immune response in an individual to provide protection from a vaccine preventable disease(s).
the organisation that holds the authorisation for marketing a Medicinal Product in a region
Organisation that holds the authorisation for the manufacturing process
A substance that the body recognizes as foreign; triggers an immune response to a specific disease with a role of an antigen. Derivable from vaccine product.
The lot number of the Administrable Immunizing Agent, as assigned by the manufacturer.
Date, assigned to the Administrable Immunizing Agent by the manufacturer, after which the agent should not be administered as product integrity cannot be guaranteed.
Used to specify the units for immunizing agent dose volume quantities
Dose Number
Series Dose Number
Vaccination series complete
Immunization Administration
The date the immunization was administered to the person.
A flag to indicate the recorded date of the immunization was estimated.
The volume of the dose injected; (e.g., influenza dose is 0.25 or 0.5).
Route by which the immunizing agent is administered to the body (intramuscular injection, subcutaneous injection, oral, etc.).
The set of body locations to or through which an immunizing agent may be administered.
When the immunization was first captured in the subject's record
Source of information regarding the reported immunization event.
Adverse Reaction
A flag to identify an adverse reaction was reported following administration of a vaccine.
Reaction date
Reaction detail
Additional information relevant to the immunization record.
Client's immunization forecast
The date the client's immunization forecast was generated
The date provided in the client's immunization forecast.
Type of immunization forecast date;  based on the immunization forecast types.
The date provided in the client's immunization forecast.
Represents the client's requirement for a particular Administrable Immunizing Agent.
Vaccination
Provides the status of the immunization event, i.e., was the vaccine dose administered?

Generic representation of the formulation administered to a client that includes one or more specific antigen(s) aimed at developing an immune response in an individual to provide protection from a vaccine preventable disease(s).
The disease that the vaccination provides protection against.
